text: Half of the fun that comes from following this project is seeing the ideas you have for the dungeons that would accompany the songs you've composed, and this one is definitely my favourite so far. One of my favourite locations in Majora's Mask was the Astral Observatory, and ever since then I've always thought Nintendo should make a space-themed Zelda dungeon. Keep up the good work! ^_^

author: Craizychaosi

text:
Love the song, sounds very melancholic of the lost technology of these beings. There could also be ghosts of these aliens, wandering in translucid form. You would have to help them with various tasks to return to the stars in the main room ceiling. Once the constellation is complete, you would have access the main boss room.

I have one concern though: don't you feel the song is "too" atmospheric? Don't you feel the upbeat battle theme would constantly ruin this smooth ambiance?

text: Man, Supra. I just realized. I have been subscribed to you for well over five years. You have never failed to disappoint me with both your musical choices and original compositions. Keep it up. Looking forward to the next few years.

text: And then with the second part, all the lights suddenly turn on, the constellations on the wall go magically bright, as if the observatory came to life once again after thousands of years of inactivity.
author: SupraDarky

text:
Yeah I know I know, it's taking me way too long to complete this project. You can blame school for that! Anyways, this theme will probably be one of the simpler ones in the series along with Dungeon 2.

The sound at the start? The door closing behind when our hero enters the dungeon. I went with a lot of reverb since I imagine a giant observatory with very large, almost empty rooms. A lot of dust covering old scientific manuscripts and tools. Also tons of constellations painted on the walls.
author: SupraDarky
